utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can't believe we've never done this before! It's sooo good! So good for Monica!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh! Look at that, time's up! My turn!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That was a half an hour?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's your timer.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know, I don't like to brag about it, but I give the best massages!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, then massage me up right nice!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah! Ahh!! Ahh!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's so good, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's so good I don't know what I've done to deserve it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Say good-bye to sore muscles!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good-bye muscles!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm telling you, she gives the worst massages ever!! Okay, it was like she was torturing me for information. And I wanted to give it up I just—I didn't know what it was!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, for the first time in my life I'm in a real relationship. Okay, I'm not gonna screw that up by y'know, telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And the bunny got away.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This would be the place where you explain the hat.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Yeah, look there's this play all right? And I'm up for the part of this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion stuff.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And you're gonna make them all disappear.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, if you wanna look good, why don't you just come down to the store? I'll help you out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great! Thanks, Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure! God, please take those off!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, how's it going?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Umm, well, only okay because I just got back from, from the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah, no-no-no. I'm fine. I'm okay, but umm, my Grandma sorta died.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs! Sorry!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's okay, I mean she had a really incredible life. And it's not like I'm never gonna see her again, y'know she's gonna visit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well maybe, maybe she's with us right now?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, her first day on a new spiritual plane and she's gonna come to the coffeehouse!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Guys! Guys! I just saw two people having sex in a car right outside.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhh, Pheebs' Grandmother just died.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh my God, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's okay. Actually y'know what, it's kinda cool. 'Cause it's like y'know, one life ends and another begins.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Not the way they're doing it. What, what happened? How did she die?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well umm, okay we were in the market and she bent down to get some yogurt and she just never came back up again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It was really sweet. The last thing she said to me was; "Okay dear, you go get the eggs and I'm gonna get the yogurt and we'll meet at the checkout counter." And y'know what? We will meet at the checkout counter.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay now Joey, y'know that since you're returning all of this stuff right after the audition you're gonna have to wear underwear?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, it's missing something. Ooh, I know! Umm, okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really? A purse?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's not a purse! It's a shoulder bag.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It looks like a women's purse.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No Joey, look. Trust me, all the men are wearing them in the spring catalog. Look. See look, men, carrying the bag.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See look, women, carrying the bag. But it is odd how a women's purse looks good on me, a man.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Exactly! Unisex!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe you need sex. I had sex a couple days ago.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No Joey! U-N-I-sex.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I ain't gonna say no to that.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Oh great! Oh, you. Umm, what's up?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, well I sorta have some bad news, can I come in?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Umm, yeah—no thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, well, umm Grandma died.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Wow! Didn't she die like five years ago?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, she just died today! Okay, umm, we're having a memorial service tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Okay, I know that I went to that all ready.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No you didn't!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Well, then who's been dead for five years?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, lots of people! Look, are you coming to memorial service or not?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Umm, no. See I already thought she was dead so I kinda made my peace with it. Plus, I'm going to a concert tomorrow. So… I'd invite you, but umm, I only have two tickets left.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine. Okay, enjoy your concert.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Thanks! Enjoy your funeral.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow! You look just like your son Mrs. Tribbiani!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Your make-up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, what are you doing with the bag? You're audition is not until tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, but sandwich time is right now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, y'know you get any mustard on that bag, you can't return it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why would I return it? I love this bag!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, then you owe me $350.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am definitely gonna get thanks to you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What's the part, Anti-man?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, don't listen to them. I think it's sexy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: U-N-I-sexy?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well hello, Mrs. Penella! Thank you so much for coming! Well, okay look, here's your umm, 3-D glasses and Reverend Pong will tell you when to put them on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi sweetie!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, how are you holding up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, y'know what? My Grandma had the exact same bag!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here, I brought you some flowers.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pulling flowers out it makes the bag look a lot more masculine.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oops, I'm sorry. Excuse me. Is this the umm, the memorial?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, welcome.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hello. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm here's your 3-D glasses.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, umm, all right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So how did you know Francis?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Well I actually, I-I really, I haven't seen her for years. But umm, well I-I was pretty tight with-with her and her daughter.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?! What's your name?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Umm, Frank Buffay.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Y'know what? Strike that. My name uh, actually is-is Joe. Uh, Joe umm, Hill.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You're Frank Buffay?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Shh! No! Joe Hill!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You just said…

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Y'know what, I gotta go. And thank you so much for coming.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! What honey?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That was my dad!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey you guys, check it out. Check it out. It's like it's coming right at me.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, did you catch him?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wh-what did he say?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He said, "Nice to meet you Glenda." Well, obviously I couldn't give him my real name?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why?! Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on, you saw the way he ran out of here! What do you think? He's gonna stick around and talk to the daughter he abandoned!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What did you say to him?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I said, I told him y'know, that I was the executor person of Francis' will and that I needed to talk to him so I'm gonna meet him at the coffee house later.

utterance.speaker: The Pastor
utterance.content: Could everyone please take their seats?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, well, I just can't think about that right now. I just wanna say good-bye to my Grandma.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, let's go say good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I'm off to my audition. How do I look?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahhh, I think you look great! That bag is gonna get you that part.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And a date with a man!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'know what? Make fun all you want. This is a great bag! Okay? And it's as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact that Joey, comes with a bag!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, I'd better go too. I have to go talk to my dad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, Pheebs, what are you gonna say? Are you gonna tell him who you are?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, no, not at first 'cause I-I don't want to freak him out

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, but aren't you pissed at him?! I mean this guy abandoned you! I gotta tell you if this were me, this guy would be in some serious physical danger! I mean I-I-I'd walk in there and I'd be like, "Yo, dad! You and me outside right now!" I kinda scared myself.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, at least you scared someone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y'know it's funny, you'd think I'd be angry. I mean, you'd think I'd wanna rip his tiny little head off. Fortunately, I'm past it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe, you do seem a little tense. Here, let me help you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Get off!! Ow!! Oh, stop it!! Why?! Why are you doing that to me?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: As a masseuse and a human, I'm begging you, never do that to anyone!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I give good massages! I used to give them to Rachel all the time before she got allergic! And-and-and Chandler loves them! Watch!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He-he does not like it! He hates it! He's in pain!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No he's not!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, he is!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm sorry but, ow-owww-owww!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You've been lying to me? I can't believe you'd do that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, maybe he just didn't want to hurt your feelings.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But the minute we start to lie to each other… And by 'we' I mean society.

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: Any time you're ready, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, you must be new here. Why don't we get a table and I'll buy you a drink.

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Could you, could you try it without the purse?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Well, you must be new here. Maybe we should—I'm sorry, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: Sure. What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, first it's not a purse.

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: Okay, anytime.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not. It's a man's bag!

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: Okayyyy! Anddd, go!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right look, let me show you the catalog! See? Huh? It's the latest thing! Everyone's got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone's carrying them!

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: Umm, do you sell these bags?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: Okay! Thank you! That was great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah but I didn’t read anything.

utterance.speaker: The Casting Director
utterance.content: I think we've seen enough!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! All right, I'll see ya. We got it! We got it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, is Rachel here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Listen, I just wanted to apologize about this afternoon and the whole massage thing. Y'know? I-I really like 'em.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, please, stop! Look, we're supposed to be honest with each other. I-I just wish you could tell me—just say, "I don't like your massages."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't like your massages.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See? It's no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, but now see you're crying!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm not crying about that! I'm crying about something that happened at work.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My boyfriend said he didn't like my massages.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's okay, you don't have to be the best at everything.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! You don't know me at all!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, you give the worst massages in the world.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm crying here!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, hear me out. Okay? You give the best bad massages. If anybody was looking for the best bad massage and they were thinking to themselves, "Who's the best of that?" They'd have to go to you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Huh. So you're saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad massage, well who would get that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, it would be you! You! Monica! And you'd get all the votes!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Absolutely!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. I suck!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, thank you for meeting with me.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Thank you. All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come, sit. Sit. Sit! Umm, all righty, before we get started I just—I need you to state for the official record that you are in fact Frank Buffay.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Oh yes. Yes, yes, I am, uh-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: So, what did Francis leave me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Well, that's why you wanted me to come, right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yes. Yes. Yeah—no. She did. She left you umm, this lipstick.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Oh. Huh. It's huh, well it's oh it's—ew used. Umm, cool.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. I have just a few questions to ask so I'm going to get out my official forms. Okay, so, question 1) You and uh, you were married to Francis' daughter Lilly, is that correct?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Yes, yes I was.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, umm, question 2) Umm, did that marriage end A. Happily, B. Medium, or C. In the total abandonment of her and her two children?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: It really says that?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. See?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Well then I guess then I-I would I would have to say C.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmm, okay, total abandonment. Okay, reasons for abandonment, A. Top secret government work, B. Amnesia, or C. Or you're just a selfish, irresponsible bad, bad man?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Y'know, I don't think I want the lipstick that much. But umm… Oh, would you do me a favor? And umm, would you, would you give Lilly that, please?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Well Lilly, when you see Lilly would you give her that, that note? Because I wanted to talk to her at the memorial but, well I pictured her getting mad at me the way you got mad at me and I well, I chickened out. So, uh, I wrote her that note, would you give it to her please?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But you-you-you came to see Lilly?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Lilly's dead.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: She what?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She's dead.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, if she isn't then cremating her was a big mistake.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: I can't believe this. I just—I can't believe this. How-how—Oh my God. How long ago?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 17 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Oh! What about, what about the girls?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, Ursula is a waitress and-and she lives in Soho. And Phoebe, is on this couch.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yep, lipstick and a daughter, big day for you!

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Phoebe, I-I-I-umm, Oops. I just, I-I-I-I don’t, I don’t know what to say. I just can't believe that you're my daughter, you're so pretty.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes. Well, that's neither here nor there.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: So would it, would it make you feel better if I said I was very, very sorry that I left?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y'know what, it doesn’t matter what you say it's not gonna make a difference anyway, so you can just go.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: All right. Well, y'know in my defense I was a lousy father.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That's a defense?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Yes. Yes it is. I burned the formula and I put your diapers on backwards. I mean, I made up a song to sing you to sleep, but that made you cry even more!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You make up songs?

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: Well no, just-just that one. But, it was stupid. Let's see, how did it, how did it go. Umm.

utterance.speaker: Frank Sr.
utterance.content: I just, I y'know, I'm not very good at this. So, umm…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I am.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not yet, no.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey man, how did the audition go?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Estelle said I didn't get it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! Why? Joey you were so ready for it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems with me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What kind of problem?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well to tell you the truth, they uh, they had a problem with the bag!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nooooo!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'know what? It was a stupid play anyway!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know, Joey, I think it's time to give up the bag.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don't wanna give up the bag. I don't have to give up the bag! Do I Rach? Oh, you think I should give up the bag!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey wait, Joey, I’m sorry I mean as terrific as I think you are with it…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: …I just don't know if the world is ready for you and your bag.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can't believe I'm hearing this!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! I'm not saying that you shouldn’t have a bag, I just—it's just there are other bags that are a little less umm, controversial.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah umm, they're called wallets.
